page.title: 06RELIGION
page.content: All Saints Church Roos was once under the patronage of the Prior of Kirkham Abbey and Archbishop,Walter Gray in 1223.The building then was of wood and rectangular in shape.By the reign of Elizabeth 1 the church and land was under the control of Lord Burghley.In 1776 the land and rights were handed to the Sykes family.They then began to alter the church to its present form: nave,chancel,two aisles and a tower at the west end.The tower has a belfry with a peel of 5 bells.The church is built of sandstone round the windows, doors and corners with flint fill-in on the walls.The entry to the church is from a wooden gateway,along an avenue of boxed yew trees and a flight of stone steps.The church yard is well kept and used as the village graveyard.
